The Eternal Flailer

Greetings all!

This build draft looked nice:
- High fighter for all the combat feats you could want
- Bard for great skill dumps, and to qualify for PM
- Palemaster for high AC (+18 AC from Tumble 40 and PM 16), crit/sneak immunity, epic mage armor / epic warding

The more I play PM, the more I want higher AB than the typical low 40s, I get to mundane AB 45 here with Str 34->46. Taunt can add effective +6 AB to 51, improved disarm situational AB up to +8 AB to 59
With all that PM AC, crit/sneak immunity plus expertise means taunting should be very safe.

I go human and put Int to 16 to make maximal use of the skills available from Bard, it just keeps wanting more skill points. Dwarf adds 40hp at the cost of 43 skill points (likely needing to drop Taunt)

If one wants dev crit swap lightning reflexes for great cleave, and two great strengths for overwhelming / devastating critical, Str 32, AB 44, 
I am honestly happy to play less dev crit builds, sometimes it is satisfying to see those huge numbers without a combatant being terminated too soon.

These are similar builds:
- Lord of Gruumish - 45 AB half orc PM 16 build draft, goes dev crit at level 21, less skill points, I want to boost the saves a bit more reading it again
- The Myrmidon Eternal by Grizzled_Dwarflord, 42 AB PM 20 great build
- The Charnel Lord by Grizzled_Dwarflord, 40 AB PM 24 dev crit, lots of epic spells
- DeathDozer by Faign, same level split, 42 AB, has three epic spells 

I was interested to adjust the ending PM levels to add an extra epic level spell in there like DeathDozer does, but I was unsure if spells like greater ruin, hellball, mummy dust or dragon knight would add more to the build than higher AB. It was an interesting idea.
